passage:
(1) The world's largest cities are sprawling urban areas that house millions of people and serve as economic, cultural, and political hubs. Tokyo, the capital of Japan, is currently the most populous city in the world with about 37 million residents in its metropolitan area. Located on the eastern coast of Japan's main island, Tokyo combines ancient traditions with ultramodern lifestyles, creating a unique cultural landscape.

(2) Another massive urban center is Delhi, India, which has grown rapidly in recent decades to become the second largest city globally. With approximately 32 million inhabitants, Delhi faces significant challenges related to infrastructure, pollution, and housing. Despite these issues, the city continues to attract migrants from rural areas who come seeking better economic opportunities and improved living conditions.

(3) In North America, Mexico City stands as one of the largest urban areas in the Western Hemisphere. Built on the site of the ancient Aztec capital Tenochtitlan, this city sits in a valley surrounded by mountains and volcanoes. Its unique geography creates challenges for urban planning and environmental management, particularly regarding air quality and water supply for its 22 million residents.

(4) Shanghai represents China's rapid urbanization, transforming from a fishing village into a global financial center with more than 28 million people. The city's skyline is dominated by futuristic skyscrapers, including the iconic Oriental Pearl Tower. Shanghai's strategic location on the Yangtze River Delta has helped it become one of the world's busiest shipping ports and a crucial link in global trade networks.

(5) São Paulo, Brazil's largest city and the biggest in South America, completes our overview of major global urban centers. Home to approximately 22 million people, São Paulo is known for its diverse population, including the largest Japanese community outside Japan. The city serves as Brazil's financial center and features a mix of architectural styles reflecting its history of immigration and rapid development throughout the 20th century.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a form of the present perfect tense?

options.A: She has lived here for ten years.
options.B: They have been studying since morning.
options.C: We have already finished the project.
options.D: He was working when I called.

questions.question: Choose the correct conditional sentence:

options.A: If I will see him, I will tell him.
options.B: If I would see him, I will tell him.
options.C: If I see him, I will tell him.
options.D: If I saw him, I would told him.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of articles:

options.A: She is the best student in an entire school.
options.B: I need a umbrella because it's raining.
options.C: Please give me the apple from the table.
options.D: He is best player on team.

options.A: The book was wrote by a famous author.
options.B: The letter is being written by Sarah.
options.C: The house has been build last year.
options.D: The cake will making by my mother.

options.A: This book is more interesting than that one.
options.B: She is more taller than her sister.
options.C: The blue car is more cheaper than the red one.
options.D: This exercise is more easier than the previous one.

options.A: She said that she will go tomorrow.
options.B: He told me that he has finished his homework.
options.C: They said they were going to the party that night.
options.D: The teacher told us we can leave early yesterday.

options.A: She arrived to the station early.
options.C: We walked across the bridge to reach the other side.
options.D: The book is in the table.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the past continuous correctly?

options.A: I was cook dinner when the phone rang.
options.B: She was reading a book when I arrived.
options.C: They were slept when the alarm went off.
options.D: He was drove to work when he saw the accident.

questions.question: Identify the sentence with the correct use of modal verbs:

options.A: You must to attend the meeting tomorrow.
options.C: They might be late for the party.
options.D: He should to study harder for the exam.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct plural form:

options.A: The childs are playing in the garden.
options.B: There are several mouses in the basement.
options.C: The women are discussing the book.
options.D: We saw three deers in the forest.

questions.question: Select the correct relative clause:

options.A: The man which lives next door is a doctor.
options.B: The book who I read last week was interesting.
options.C: The restaurant where we had dinner was excellent.
options.D: The girl what I met yesterday is my cousin.

questions.question: Identify the correct verb agreement:

options.A: Each of the students have a book.
options.B: The number of accidents have increased.
options.C: Neither of them are going to the party.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct future form:

options.A: I will meeting you at the station.
options.B: She is going to visiting her grandmother next week.
options.C: The train leaves at 5 PM tomorrow.
options.D: We will been waiting for you.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct word order:

options.A: Always he is late for class.
options.B: I know where is the book.
options.C: She asked me what time it was.
options.D: Yesterday went we to the cinema.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses the present perfect continuous?

options.A: I have been knowing her for five years.
options.B: She has been studying English since three hours.
options.C: They have been waiting for the bus for 30 minutes.
options.D: He has been worked here since 2010.
